title: Dutch police discover family locked in basement on farm for 9 years
text:
A family of six had been locked away in a hidden room behind a cupboard on a remote Dutch farm “waiting for the end of time” before one member of the household made a remarkable break for freedom.

Dutch police, acting on a tip-off, discovered five young adults aged between 18 and 25 and an older man believed to be their father near Ruinerwold, a village in the northern province of Drenthe.

The family had not seen the world outside the expansive rented farmhouse for nine years, according to police.

A 58-year-old man — named by Dutch newspaper De Telegraaf as Josef B — was arrested at the farm after one of the siblings, 25, escaped the makeshift living quarters and found his way to a local pub.

An employee at the pub told RTV Drenthe the young man was looking scruffy and bewildered and had long, thick hair.

media_camera An aerial picture taken on October 15 shows a view of the farm where six children had been living in a small room. Picture: Wilbert Bijzitter/ANP/AFP

media_camera The family had been surviving on vegetables and animals tended in a secluded garden. Picture: Wilbert Bijzitter/EPA/AAP

He said that before the young man told him the story and asked for help, he ordered and drank five beers.

“He was very confused,” Chris Westerbeek told the broadcaster.

“You could see he had no idea where he was or what he was doing. He said he had run away and that he urgently needed help.

“He said he had brothers and sisters who lived at the farm. He said he was the oldest and wanted to end the way they were living.”

The 25-year-old told the publican he had never been to school and that he escaped at night because it “was not possible during the day”.

When police attended, they arrested the 58-year-old man. Police said he was uncooperative.

“We found six people living in a small space in the house which could be locked, not a cellar,” police said in a statement.

“It is unclear if they resided there voluntarily. They say they are a family, a father and five children.”

De Telegraaf describes Josef B as “a strange figure, not very talkative”.

A neighbor of the woodworking company where Mr B works told the newspaper he was “extremely friendly but difficult to reach, with a large bundle of hair and a thick beard.

“I took packages for him, tools and the like, but I found it annoying that I could reach him so badly by telephone.”

Local mayor Roger De Groot said it was believed the children’s mother had died.

“As far as I know their mother died before they arrived there,” he said.

“Police found makeshift living quarters where the family was living in hiding. I’ve never seen anything like it.”

media_camera Chris Westerbeek talks to local reporters about the young man who walked into his pub after nine years inside an isolated farmhouse. Picture: Backgrid

media_camera The pub where a member of the family drank beer and told a publican about his hidden siblings.

The children are believed to have existed without the knowledge of authorities or neighbours at the remote farm hidden behind trees with an access road crossing a bridge that is hardly visible from the main road.

According to local reports, the family had been surviving on vegetables and animals tended in a secluded garden.

A neighbour confirmed to local media that only one person had been seen at the premises over the years.

He told Dagblad van het Noorden he was “totally surprised” to hear an entire family had inside the home the entire time he lived next door.

“I am shaking on my legs,” he told the newspaper.

A local postman said he had never once delivered any mail to the home.

“It’s actually pretty strange, now I come to think about it,” he told Algemeen Dagblad news website.

The siblings were receiving treatment at an undisclosed location, the mayor said at a press conference on Tuesday.

“I understand there are a lot of questions,” de Groot said. “We have many too. The police are investigating all possible scenarios.

“The family is in a safe place. They need rest.”

More to come.

Originally published as Family locked in secret room for 9 years
description: The mysterious father figure who lived with five adult children in a hidden farm basement has been named after one of the kids escaped.
